feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system does not support automatic salary calculation based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not the active calculation method. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. When calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity, the system fails to recognize 2024 as a leap year, causing a calculation discrepancy of approximately AED 17.26.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, leading to potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: The daily wage calculator lacks dynamic leap year handling in service period computations, requiring system enhancement to correctly recognize and incorporate 366-day years.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts produces consistently lower amounts by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals. The formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but results in slightly incorrect End of Service (EOS) calculations across all employees.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Decimal precision error in pro-rated salary computations affects final settlement accuracy
known_issues.gap_statement: The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485). Detailed breakdown shows system calculation follows specific service duration and daily wage formula rules.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential minor differences between system and manual gratuity calculations due to precise calculation methodology
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation method may require additional transparency to align with manual calculation expectations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while the manual calculation included 913 days by explicitly counting the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Days Worked Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing gratuity, adding one extra day to the total job tenure calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation affects gratuity computation precision
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential rounding or calculation logic issue in days worked aggregation

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary using a predefined daily rate configuration that may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The specific case showed a calculation dividing daily wage by 30 days instead of 31 days, resulting in a slight salary amount difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to policy-configured daily rate divisor, which may not flexibly adapt to actual month lengths.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, especially regarding daily rate divisor configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days variation impacts leave salary accrual consistency
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with varying working days.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary and salary proration are configured independently, leading to potential mismatches in daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations use separate configurations with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic does not handle dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system experiences data synchronization problems between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are added after leave requests. This causes mismatches in daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deductions that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across different system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpredictable Deduction Calculations
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses non-standard 30.42 day divisor instead of calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed expected monthly salary amounts

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations for unpaid leave deductions. This results in deductions being calculated using a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not reflect the month when leave occurred.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate recalculated based on payroll processing month rather than stored from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for consistent daily rate display that preserves initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month (313 working days per year, calculated as 365 - 52 weekly offs)
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in actual worked days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly edit the leave policy formula when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations may be incorrect if salary configuration is changed after leave request creation
limitations.impact: Potential payroll calculation errors if salary configurations are not carefully managed

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to dynamically adjust for leap years when calculating total service period.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee End of Service gratuity benefits due to incorrect day counting

limitations.title: Pro-Rated Calculation Formula
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic + allowances) / 30, which may not account for precise decimal representations
limitations.impact: Potential small discrepancies in pro-rated salary calculations

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraints
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month under monthly policy, meaning incomplete months are not automatically included in End of Service (EOS) calculations
limitations.impact: Mid-month departures will not automatically include current month's leave balance

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Days Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for clients with different computational preferences

limitations.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows predefined policy configurations that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify daily wage divisor or calculation method per individual leave request

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Based on Working Days
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment daily wage is calculated based on the number of working days in a month, which can vary
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ month-to-month due to working days variation

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies and manual configuration required to align methods

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration calculates based on days marked as working in the employee's assigned work week configuration
limitations.impact: Proration may differ from traditional calendar day calculations if work week is non-standard

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past; fails for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically reconcile or remove payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to resolve.

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations and requires precise tracking of working days

limitations.title: Custom Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System calculates daily wage by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 (custom days) instead of using exact calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not precisely match expected monthly salary, requiring manual reconciliation

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations must account for varying number of days in different months, particularly February in leap years.
limitations.impact: Potential discrepancies in unpaid leave deduction calculations if not handled precisely

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to automatically adjust salary based on worked days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current payroll system lacks dynamic attendance-based salary calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings use different salary components (basic + allowances) compared to leave policy (basic only)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings to understand the active formula

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in gratuity amount due to incorrect day counting
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses fixed 365-day year calculation, ignoring leap year specifics
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and adjust calculation to use 366 days for 2024, consulting MOHRE guidelines

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service calculations show amounts less than expected by small decimal points
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Rounding or precision issue in daily wage calculation formula
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and potentially adjust final settlement amounts

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave balance not automatically included for mid-month departure
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy restricts automatic prorating of leave days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust leave balance in EOS section or switch to conditional daily accrual policy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: User confusion about how daily wage is divided for leave salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation follows predefined policy configuration, not actual calendar days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy settings before submitting leave request

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent leave salary accrual calculations across months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use 'custom days' setting for leave encashments to potentially achieve more consistent calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and system-calculated leave salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or verify specific calculation method for each scenario

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's work week setup to confirm working days configuration

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full salary displayed instead of prorated amount for offboarded employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System's inability to handle departure dates in future relative to payroll processing
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary based on daily rate: (Monthly Salary / 30) * Days Worked

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Payroll deductions remain after deleting leave request
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Synchronization failure between leave management and payroll systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual removal of duplicate deductions may be required. Contact system administrator for backend cleanup.

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Mismatch between public holiday configuration and leave request timing
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual deduction adjustment or reopening previous payroll cycles (not recommended)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Deduction amount exceeds expected monthly salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculated as 4300/30.42 = 141.35, then multiplied by days in leave period (31 days = 4,381.99)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify unpaid leave policy settings and understand the 30.42 days divisor used in calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect daily rate displayed in remarks
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System defaulting to 31 days instead of using actual calendar days for the month
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount, not just the remarks text. Confirm calculation uses correct number of calendar days.

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected salary deduction during unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses global daily rate configuration instead of policy-specific calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global unpaid leave daily rate settings and understand their precedence over policy configurations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Daily rate shows incorrect month, causing user confusion
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System recalculates daily rate based on current payroll month instead of storing original leave occurrence month rate
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate matches leave occurrence month; check stored daily rate versus recalculated rate

claims_to_validate.statement: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485). Detailed breakdown shows system calculation follows specific service duration and daily wage formula rules.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while the manual calculation included 913 days by explicitly counting the leap day.

claims_to_validate.title: Days Worked Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing gratuity, adding one extra day to the total job tenure calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary using a predefined daily rate configuration that may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The specific case showed a calculation dividing daily wage by 30 days instead of 31 days, resulting in a slight salary amount difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary and salary proration are configured independently, leading to potential mismatches in daily wage calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system experiences data synchronization problems between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are added after leave requests. This causes mismatches in daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deductions that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpredictable Deduction Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations for unpaid leave deductions. This results in deductions being calculated using a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not reflect the month when leave occurred.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month (313 working days per year, calculated as 365 - 52 weekly offs)

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations may be incorrect if salary configuration is changed after leave request creation

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to dynamically adjust for leap years when calculating total service period.

claims_to_validate.title: Pro-Rated Calculation Formula
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic + allowances) / 30, which may not account for precise decimal representations

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraints
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month under monthly policy, meaning incomplete months are not automatically included in End of Service (EOS) calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguity in Days Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation Method

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
